title: Top two in linen, garments: Spotless pitches Laundries
text:
Spotless has kicked off the sale of its commercial laundries business, telling private equity firms and other interested parties it should make close to $60 million earnings in the 2020 financial year.

Street Talk can reveal Spotless, which is controlled by Downer Group, has mandated Sydney-based corporate adviser VCA Partners to help find a buyer and run an auction in coming months.

Spotless Laundries is not core to Downer boss Grant Fenn's "asset-light, services-focused" business model. Michele Mossop

VCA Partners kicked off its search in recent days, sending a sale flyer to private equity firms and other trade players.

Interested parties were told Spotless Laundries was expected to record $265.3 million revenue and $59.1 million in earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation in the 2020 financial year, according to the flyer obtained by Street Talk.

The business was pitched as the No.1 player in linen, washing sheets and the like for health care and aged care providers, and had continuously served its to biggest customers for more than 20 years on average.
description: Spotless has kicked off the sale of its commercial laundries business.
